parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Fuel tank leakage can cause fuel to spray or leak onto the road, creating a hazardous situation for the rider and other vehicles. It can also lead to a fire hazard, especially if the fuel comes into contact with an ignition source.
symptoms: Fuel smell while running the motorcycle
puddle of fuel under the seat
pinhole-sized leak in the fuel tank
minute cracks on the top of the fuel tank area.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Stalling issues can cause the motorcycle to suddenly stop, leading to accidents or near-misses, especially when riding in heavy traffic or at high speeds. This can put the rider's safety at risk.
symptoms: Motorcycle stalls at stops
stalls when coming to an idle
backfires when accelerating or slowing down
intermittent stalling when accelerating or decelerating.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Faulty rear brake can lead to reduced stopping power, increasing the risk of accidents or injuries.
symptoms: Rear brake issues
recalled for faulty rear brake.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Front rim buckling can cause the motorcycle to lose control, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: Front rim buckled where the rim is welded together
caused by heating and cooling of the rim during the welding process.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front fork can cause loss of control, accidents, and injuries, especially during braking or deceleration.
symptoms: The front fork axle separates from the fork
causing the motorcycle to slide or lose control
often resulting in accidents and injuries.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rearview mirrors can cause a significant reduction in visibility, leading to a dangerous riding situation, especially at high speeds or in heavy wind conditions.
symptoms: The rearview mirrors move or turn inward
rendering them useless
especially at high speeds; the mirrors fold back or move out of adjustment
requiring constant readjustment; the mirrors are affected by hot weather
causing them to move more frequently.
